title: Contractor - Associate, Laboratory Management
description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
This position is responsible for performing the functions required to support laboratory operations at Genmab's Princeton location.  

 Role
As Laboratory Management Associate, Translational Research, you would ensure the efficient and effective day to day support of lab operations including overseeing the stocking of standard laboratory consumables and supplies, working closely with facilities for infrastructure and vendor management, supply management and trainings for Genmab laboratory scientists and personnel.
The Laboratory Management Associate, Translational Research will work closely with other departments such as finance (for purchasing), facilities, and all departments conducting laboratory experimentation. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong organizational agility, the ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects, and a demonstrated drive for results.  

Responsibilities* Oversee general laboratory maintenance and facility-related work requests including renovation and new construction projects
* Monitor space needs, including benches and temperature-controlled storage and ensure that needs are met.
* Set guidelines for laboratory etiquette and ensure compliance in collaboration with management.
* Maintain laboratory cleaning schedule and organize clean-outs as necessary
* Support laboratory safety efforts, conduct safety inspections with EHS, escalate any safety concerns such as PPE issues and/or unsafe work practices.
* Maintain vendor relationships for laboratory supplies, maintain min/max point of use consumables supply.
* Oversee third party service group to ensure that adequate supplies are available and accessible.
* Ensure that general use lab items not monitored by third party services are in adequate supply such as dry ice, CO2, laboratory coats.
* Monitor some supply related budgetary items, oversee some in lab purchases keep in line with preferred brands to support cost savings structure
* Effectively organize and present overall laboratory infrastructure health updates in weekly TM department meetings.
  

  

Requirements* BS and 3-5 years of previous experience in related area
* Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) experience is strongly preferred.
* Ability to enable new equipment purchases, implementation and decommissioning, removal of obsolete or unnecessary equipment, schedule calibration of general use benchtop items such as pipettes, balances, and pH meters.
* Enthusiasm, willingness to learn, strong work ethic and excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

About You* You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
* You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
* You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
* You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
* You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
* You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
* You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Founded in 1999 in Copenhagen, Denmark, Genmab is an innovative biotech company that has become a leader in antibody biology and innovation. Our product pipeline and next-generation antibody technologies are the result of our strong company culture, a deep passion for innovation, and desire to transform cancer treatment and serious diseases.
When you work with us, you’ll be part of a warm, fun, dynamic community, and team up with some of the best, most authentic individuals in locations around the world, who care deeply and share in a relentless drive to innovate and create transformational medicines. People who are candid, impact-driven, and a little unconventional; who seek out and embrace the opportunity to build new and bold futures within a rapidly growing and innovative biotech company; who bring their full selves to work and show up for each other - rolling up their sleeves to get the job done. This translates into a place where you can be authentically you; are empowered to innovate, build solutions, and execute; feel cared for and supported in growth; and are a critical part of changing the lives of patients around the world through transformative cancer treatment.
Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website Job Applicant Privacy Notice (genmab.com).
company_description: Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose of improving the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases.

description:

title: Executive Assistant(Media/Entertaiment background)
description:
**Summary:**  

Our client an undisputed leader in the streaming technology and publishing industry is looking for a flexible multitasker who takes initiative, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and can work independently. Reporting to the Head of Regional Content, North America, and providing support across the region's senior content leads, with a focus on the Head of Creative Development, the ideal candidate will be able to quickly shift priorities as different needs arise.  

The person in this role must be comfortable operating in an agile environment and possess solid experience in successfully navigating the complexities of a large organization as well as external partners, in addition to being a strong team player with exceptional attention to detail. The ideal candidate must also be resourceful, able to find solutions to challenges that may or may not directly relate to the role (including on-site services, troubleshooting internal system issues, etc.).  

  

**About the role:**  

* Proactively manage executives' calendars, including scheduling large and/or complex meetings with external parties (key customers, such as top agents, production companies, and their coordinators/assistants), internal teams, and/or high-level executives who may also work in different time zones
* Work closely with fellow coordinators/executive assistants to accommodate more complex meetings involving senior management; coordinate out-of-office coverage with fellow Content EAs to ensure continued executive support.
* Plan/coordinate/modify travel arrangements (flight, hotel, train, car service) and submit expense reports; monitor spend on corporate credit card.
* Work with Internal Communications and Content Marketing to manage executive presence at high-profile public events: book travel, create itineraries, provide prep materials, arrange professional styling and/or car service, etc. as needed.
* Work with North America content leadership to facilitate internal communication on behalf of the team leads and across multiple regions.
* Provide relationship management support, which may include follow-up requests/calls, data entry, and more
* Assisting with the planning and coordination for large team meetings and events (full team all-hands meetings and offsites, etc.)
* Perform other administrative support duties, as appropriate and needed (e.g., visitor registration, catering, parking, etc.)


  

**Qualifications:**  

* Excellent interpersonal skills and professionalism are crucial
* Familiarity with Outlook and the Microsoft Suite (Word and Excel in particular)
* Strong verbal and communications skills
* Strong organizational skills
* Strong prioritization skills and ability to multi-task
* Ability to work in a fast paced and evolving environment and maintain composure and clarity
* Discernment, thinking ability: knowing when to raise a potential issue and providing solutions
* Accountability: willing to own and be responsible for accomplishing tasks, despite challenges, without always being asked

title: Literacy Coach Kindergarten through 2nd grade
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Flexible schedule
* Opportunity for advancement

  

**ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION**  

  

At the Center for Student Achievement Solutions, we equip school leaders and teachers with the tools to analyze, adapt, and grow to create a future where every child has the opportunity to flourish. Our mission goes beyond improving test scores—our goal is to customize solutions to help school leaders and teachers achieve nothing short of excellence. To learn more about the Center for Student Achievement Solutions, click here.  

  

**ABOUT THE POSITION**  

  

**Literacy Coach Consultant Grades K-2 – (Part-Time Per Diem Position)**  

  

The Center for Student Achievement Solutions content expert educational consultants are considered a critical lever in partnering with districts and schools to improve classroom instruction, accelerate learning, and close opportunity gaps.  

  

**Major Responsibilities and Duties**  

* Develop positive and supportive relationships with school leaders, classroom teachers, specialized professionals, and paraprofessionals.
* Facilitate on-site job-embedded professional development and coaching that are interactive and impactful within the coaching cycle to support the implementation of the district’s literacy curriculum and supplemental programs.
* Provide strengths-based one-to-one or small group coaching and facilitate grade-level team meetings for K-2 educators.
* Demonstrate and model a structured approach to literacy instruction and evidence-based strategies to support and improve teaching and learning for K-2 educators.
* Co-plan lesson plans, differentiation strategies, intervention supports, and formative assessments for literacy teachers in grades K-2.
* Observe classroom instruction, student engagement, and student work products to measure their impact on student achievement for literacy teachers in grades K-2.
* Engage in reflective coaching conversations and conferencing to support individual and small groups of teachers as they strive to enhance and refine their practices to impact student achievement in grades K-2.
* Utilize and interpret literacy-based screenings, assessments, and progress monitoring data to formulate and successfully implement an action plan.
* Integrate the district’s approved curriculum resources in support of the school’s literacy action plan.

  

**Candidate Qualifications**  

  

**Education**  

* A master’s degree or higher in literacy, special education, curriculum and instruction, early childhood education, education administration, or a related field.
* Deep understanding of structured literacy and the science of reading.
* Training in Reading First, LETRS, Orton Gillingham, Wilson Methodology, or other structured approaches to literacy instruction is preferred; certification is preferred.

  

**Teaching Experience in Elementary School Grades K-2**  

* At least five years of successful teaching and/or administration experience using a structured literacy approach.
* In-depth knowledge of curriculum programs in evidence-based reading instruction and pedagogical approaches that are interactive, engaging, and impact student achievement.
* Proven track record of helping students achieve success, with an emphasis on Title 1, English Language Learners, and Students with Disabilities in grades K-2 evidence-based reading programs and practices.

  

**Instructional Coaching Experience**  

* Three or more years of experience facilitating professional development and engaging teachers and administrators in the coaching cycle within a school setting or supporting schools to improve student achievement.
* Ability to design and deliver high-quality job-embedded professional development for administrators and teachers.
* Outstanding presentation and facilitation skills.

  

**Enjoy the Following Benefits**
  

* Competitive pay (based on a per diem scale generally agreed upon during the interview process).
* We provide training and ongoing support to content specialists to ensure that you are proficient in delivering high-quality professional development experiences.
* Opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of educators and students.

title: Copywriter
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

  

At Muslim hands we believe that everyone has the right to an education; access to food and clean water; and the means to support themselves, their family and their community. Our dedication to fighting the root causes of poverty and creating a fairer world for all are inspired by the values of our faith.  

  

The Muslim Hands USA Office is based in New York. The Copywriter play an integral role in creating engaging content across a range of platforms including our website, blog, print publications and press releases. The postholder will be working closely with other members of the fundraising department to deliver compelling content for fundraising campaigns and donor feedback throughout the year.  

  

This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the leading Muslim charities. Digital and web are critical to the growth of Muslim Hands both in raising awareness of our work and generating online donations. The postholder will be central in expanding this area and helping further the reach of Muslim Hands.  

  

**Qualifications**  

* The successful candidate for this position will bring an excellent and dynamic email marketing skill set.
* Bachelor’s degree in English, Communications, Marketing or related field.
* Minimum 3 years of experience.
* Strong communication skills.
* Advanced copywriting skills.
* Understanding of email marketing
* Creativity, and an ability to manage multiple projects, and deadlines concurrently.
* Experience in copywriting for company profiles and websites
* Strong understanding of SEO
* Experience working with or at a non profit organization.
* Clear, concise writing style
* Frequent International travel to field offices to collect material for content
* Expertise with Microsoft Office (i.e. Word, Excel, Planner, OneNote, etc.) and Google Workspace
* Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (i.e. Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.) is a plus
* Experience with web content management systems preferred
* Confident and willing to offer new ideas and perspectives in team meetings

  

**Responsibilities**  

  

* Ensure a consistent brand and tone of voice across our written content.
* Work alongside others in the digital team, including graphic designers and video production specialists to produce engaging content for our network of websites and social media platforms.
* Experience in copywriting for company profiles and websites
* Plan the structure of online content to reflect our fundraising activities and the breadth depth of our work.
* Strong understanding of SEO
* Create copy to maximize conversion rate, search engine optimization, social media engagement and website content.
* Clear, concise writing style
* Regularly produce new high-quality content by writing suitable copy, proofing, editing, and uploading onto a CMS.
* Continually monitor website content to ensure it remains accurate, updated and interesting.
* Research, collate and prepare project feedback for dissemination to donors, partner organisations and other channels.
* Excellent people skills – warmth, empathy, and a desire to genuinely help our under resourced nonprofits
* Ability to identify and use resources creatively and proactively
* Ability to use time efficiently and purposefully
* Self-directed

  

**General Responsibilities**  

  

* To demonstrate Muslim Hands’ values and ethics in own working practices, approach and conduct

  

  

* To support with Fundraising activities from time-to-time, committing to partake in events during our peak periods.

  

  

* To undertake any reasonable responsibilities as required by Line Manager

  

  

* To promote and adhere to all Muslim Hands Policies, Procedures and Professional Practices

  

  

* NB: This Job Description is illustrative and non-exhaustive in scope. The post-holder may be required to undertake any reasonable tasks as and when required by Line Manager from time to time to reflect the changing needs of the Organization

  

  

**Benefits**  

  

  

* Compensation: $45,000 - $50,000, commensurate with experience

  

  

* Benefits: Generous PTO package; 15 paid holidays annually

  

  

* Status: Full-time; exempt

  

  

* Hybrid work model (flexible schedule)

  

  

* Monday – Friday

  

  

  

  

**Location / Travel Requirements**  

  

This position will be based in office 3 days a week in Valley Stream NY. Flexibility to work from home 2 days a week.  

  

Some travel may be required.  

  

Ability to demonstrate current eligibility to work within the United States  

  

Must be able to either: Provide a valid Criminal Record Check or Vulnerable Sector Screening when requested by Muslim Hands; or undertake to provide full cooperation for Muslim Hands to perform a Criminal Record Check or Vulnerable Sector Screening at the required level appropriate for this role.  

  

  

  

*Interested candidates can apply by please submitting a current resume, cover letter and 2 pieces of writing samples at:*  

  

  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Personal & Commercial Lines Customer Service Representative
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Bonus based on performance
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

  

**Job Description**  

The Personal & Commercial Lines CSR at Sumra Agency Inc - All State Insurance Company is responsible for maintaining solid customer relationships by handling personal and commercial lines insurance coverage inquiries and concerns with speed and professionalism through daily interaction with customers, insurance carriers, and fellow employees while conducting specific service and marketing activities.  

  

**Benefits/Perks**
  

* Competitive Pay
* Professional Development
* Job Stability in a growing industry

**Responsibilities**  

* Answer customer calls and correspondence regarding new or existing insurance policies and service all claims.
* Work with prospects to pre-qualify and understand their needs, gather necessary data, research policy options, present options, finalize and bind new coverage, cancel old policies, and negotiate with carriers when necessary.
* Set appointments and/or client calls to review existing policies, revise liability limits, explore other coverage needs, evaluate replacement costs, round out accounts, and bind renewals.
* Confer with customers to provide detailed information about products and services, quote new business, process renewals and/or cancel accounts, take payments, and provide requested documentation.
* Actively solicit increases in coverage or rounding out accounts at every service contact.
* Resolve product or service issues by clarifying the customer's concern, determining the cause of the issue, selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the issue, expediting correction or adjustment, following up to ensure resolution.
* Maintain records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, comments, and actions taken in the agency management system.
* Review audits or policies; verify accuracy and facilitate corrections, as needed, between client and carrier.
* Keep informed regarding industry information, new product information, legislation, coverages and technology to continuously improve knowledge and performance as well as collaboration with team members, mentor staff, and participate in meetings as needed.

**Qualifications**  

* Hold the insurance license required by your state and have a minimum of two years personal and commercial lines insurance account management experience, as well as a Bachelor’s Degree or comparable work experience.
* Demonstrate strong knowledge of insurance products and usages, rating procedures, underwriting procedures, coverages, and industry operations to effectively manage, maintain, and write assigned clients and prospects.
* Demonstrate strong customer focus and an excellent phone manner; display strong written and verbal communication skills and possess excellent math and reading skills to accurately perform simple calculations.
* Have the ability and tact to handle difficult customer phone calls and solve complex problems without direct supervision.
* Have a strong sense of urgency, attention to detail, organization, multi-tasking, and time management skills.
* Technology and Computer proficiency including agency management systems.

  

*This agency is independently owned and operated. Your application will go directly to the agency, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of the agency. All inquiries about employment at this agency should be made directly to the agency location, and not to NAPAA.*

title: Ropes Course Lead Facilitator
description:
Mountain Workshop, based in Fairfield County, CT, is seeking a motivated individual to be our High Ropes Course Facilitator. This Fall we will conduct programming for over 5,000 students, faculty, and school administrators from many area private schools and local public school districts focused on a variety of goals and objectives including:  

  

* Teamwork and Group Problem Solving
* Communication/Listening Skills
* Building Quality Relationships
* Empathy and the Importance of Community
* Improving School Climate
* Leadership Skills
* Understanding Civic Responsibility/Community Service

Interested parties will be trained to facilitate MW programs and gain invaluable opportunities for skill development in positive school climate, youth leadership, SEL, adventure, and experiential education activities. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates for or recent graduates with a degree in Outdoor Recreation, Adventure Recreation, Outdoor Education, Elementary or Secondary Education or a related field to gain hands-on experience working in the field with students in grades 4 -12. Facilitators will work closely with other industry professionals while receiving industry-competitive compensation. This is a great opportunity for networking and resume-building!
  

  

**Responsibilities:**
  

  

Lead the facilitation of High Ropes Course activities, including but not limited to course setup, teardown, and program oversight.

title: Coaching Coordinator
description:
COACHING COORDINATOR  

  

COMPANY PROFILE:  

Soccer Shots is the leader in youth soccer development. Our nationally recognized program offers a high energy, fun, age-appropriate introduction to the wonderful game of soccer. Our innovative curriculum emphasizes both soccer skills and character development. Our goal is simple: to leave a lasting, positive impact on every child we serve.  

  

REPORTS TO: Executive Director  

  

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: The Coaching Coordinator will play a key role in managing and supporting our team of 30+ instructors across New York City & Brooklyn territories. The Coaching Coordinator is responsible for managing instructor performance through regular evaluation and performance conversations. In this role, you will work with the Executive Director. You will be responsible for ensuring that all instructors meet the standards of program quality and creating a liberating culture within the team and the organization. We are looking for a motivated individual who understands coaching, has exceptional relational skills, is extremely organized and passionate about our mission.  

  

BENEFITS/PERKS:  

* Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
* Health savings account
* Retirement plan with 3% company match / Simple IRA
* Eligible for seasonal customer satisfaction bonus and end of year bonus
* 14 PTO days + one extra day per year of service
* 10 paid holidays
* Remote work on Fridays

  

ABOUT YOU  

* You are a person of high character, and have a positive reputation
* You are well known for being warm and welcoming in the many communities of which you are connected
* You are great at communicating with others
* You are extremely organized
* You are hungry, humble, smart, and love growing in personally & professionally
* You are a seasoned local in the NYC local area, and well versed in various communities and organizations

  

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING  

* Manage instructor performance through regular evaluations, training, performance discussions, and performance improvement plans. Provide feedback on instructors to all stake holders.
* Partner with recruiting team to identify staffing needs season to season
* Screen, interview and hire instructors
* Develop strong relationships with part-time instructors; identify key individuals that can grow within our organization
* Create and manage schedules for part-time instructors across different territories
* Lead regular instructor meetings to discuss new initiatives, trends, etc.
* Create initiatives that further elevate our core values and provide a positive experience for our part-time instructors
* Work with operations team to identify key performance indicators that improve NPS scores and share results with team of instructors
* Weekly meetings with Director of Coaching and Department Head to discuss and analyze program quality and needs Coaching
* Prior soccer experience is not required. We only require the passion for positively impacting children’s lives and look for individuals that are safety conscious, caring, organized, responsible and energetic.
* You will be the face of Soccer Shots and responsible for executing incredible sessions that showcase what Soccer Shots is all about to new instructors and key stake holders.
* Coach up to 15-18 sessions per week per season. Where possible, use coaching sessions as training opportunities for instructors.

  

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:  

* Bachelor’s Degree Required
* Minimum 1-3 years of experience working in a team in a fast-paced environment
* Minimum 1-3 years of event planning or customer service experience
* Experience working or supervising part-time employees
* Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
* Proficient in G-Suite and MS Office
* Warm, motivated and approachable personality

  

ROLE/CLASSIFICATION: The job description above is a full-time, non-exempt position.  

  

Working Hours/Location/Schedule: The position requires a minimum of 40 hours of work per week or more depending on business needs. This position has weekend and weeknight requirements as many of our programs take place during these times. This position will be working hybrid (on the field and remote) in the territory. You will work out details of your weekly agenda with the Executive Director.  

  

Performance Evaluation and Reviews:  

Soccer Shots will perform an initial review after 60 days.
company_addresses: 1020 S. Eisenhower Boulevard, Middletown, PA, United States, Pennsylvania
company_description: Soccer Shots is the premier intro-to-soccer program designed for children ages 2 to 8. With franchises across 43 US states and 2 Canadian provinces, our program serves over 500,000 children each year!

description:

**Are you compassionate, dedicated, and dependable? Do you love to go above and beyond to help others?**  

At FirstLight Home Care, our mission is clear and inspiring: to ensure that every adult experiences comfort, dignity, and independence in their own home, every single day. We’re currently searching for quality caregivers who are committed to making a difference in the lives of others. Joining our team as a Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) means becoming an essential part of this transformative journey. We believe Caregiving is not just a job – it’s a calling.  

  

Join us at FirstLight Home Care and discover how you can make a meaningful difference in the lives of those we serve. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in providing exceptional care that is personalized to meet the unique needs of our clients. Your dedication will not only enhance their quality of life but also provide peace of mind to their families.
  

  

**When we find these amazing professionals, we believe in taking really good care of them because extraordinary Caregivers are the heart and soul of our company.**  

  

Together, we can uphold our mission and create a supportive environment where comfort, dignity, and independence flourish.  

  

**Full time and Part time opportunities.**  

* Day time - min 4 hours
* Weekends
* 12 hour shifts
* Live-Ins

**Benefits:**  

* Referral Bonus Program
* Paid Orientation and Training
* Paid Sick Leave
* Holiday/Overtime Pay Incentives
* Flexible schedule
* Mileage Reimbursement
* Exceptional support team
* Fun, supportive, and safe working environment
* Employee Rewards and Recognition programs

**Position Responsibilities:** Here are the responsibilities you'll undertake in the role of a Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA):  

  

* Provide personalized, non-medical care that aligns with clients' Service Plan/Care Plan
* Assist clients with personal care tasks, including bathing, grooming, feeding, and mobility
* Provide companion care activities such as conversation, light housekeeping, meal planning, preparation, and more
* Provide medication reminders
* Monitor, Record and Report changes in the client’s physical condition, behavior, or appearance to the supervisor
* Utilize our Time Management system for Clock-in/Clock-out and Document completed tasks in accordance with company policies
* Stay updated with our relevant changing technology
* Adhere to HIPAA regulations
* Participate in quality assurance reviews and evaluations.
* Uphold, support, and promote all company policies and procedures

**Position Qualifications:** The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum skills required:  

  

* High School diploma or General Education Degree (GED), or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Previous caregiving experience (preferred)
* Possession of state-required certifications
* Valid Driver’s License with adequate auto insurance, if applicable
* A passion for caregiving and a desire to help others
* A commitment to being present and providing quality care
* Empathy, patience, kindness and respect
* Ability to carry out direction, both verbal and written
* Ability to effectively manage the demands of the job

**We serve Morris County and Somerset County.**  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a local franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this local office. All inquiries about employment at this location should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to the FirstLight Home Care Support Center.*

title: TikTok Livestream Host
description:
**Benefits:**

**About Us:**  

  

Nightsea is a subsidiary of Sailvan Times. Sailvan Times is a thriving technology-driven cross-border e-commerce company, valued at $2.5 billion since its July 2023 IPO. Specializing in high-quality sports apparel and clothing, we serve a global clientele through various platforms including Amazon, Walmart, eBay, and Wish, alongside direct sales via our websites.
  

  

**Position Summary:**  

  

We are seeking a dynamic and engaging TikTok Livestream Host to lead our daily live streams and connect with our audience in real time. As a Livestream Host, you will present and demonstrate our high-quality products, creating a lively and engaging atmosphere for viewers. You will interact with the audience, answering questions and addressing comments while collaborating with our operation team to develop creative content ideas and themes. The ideal candidate has a strong on-camera presence, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of TikTok trends and user behaviour. This position requires flexibility to accommodate live streaming sessions at various times and is based in New York City.
  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Host and manage daily live streams on TikTok, engaging with viewers in real time.


* Present products and provide detailed product demonstrations.


* Interact with the audience, answer questions, and address comments to create a lively and engaging atmosphere.


* Collaborate with the operation team to develop creative content ideas and themes for live sessions.


* Track and analyze viewer engagement metrics to continuously improve LIVE performance.


* Maintain a positive and energetic presence on camera to captivate and retain audience attention.


**Requirements:**  

  

* Proven experience as a livestream host, sales, or similar role, preferably on TikTok.


* Strong on-camera presence and excellent communication skills.


* Creativity and quick thinking to handle unexpected situations during live sessions.


* Familiarity with TikTok trends, features, and user behavior.


* Flexible schedule to accommodate live streaming sessions at various times.

* Part-time/ Full-time Position

* Paid Holidays
* PTO
* Flexible Schedule
* Competitive Pay
* Career Advancement

title: Assistant Store Manager
description:
**MINISO USA - Retail Assistant Store Manager (Full-Time)** 

MINISO is an established international brand, and we position ourselves as a variety store, popular among consumers with our high-quality products at low prices. Established from a Japanese designer and Chinese entrepreneur, MINISO has been expanding globally since 2011. In April of 2017, we started our journey within the USA. MINISO is grshidftowing as the world’s #1 IP design retail group and wants you to help grow the company even further!

If you love creating a culture by embracing diversity, customer centricity, execution, innovation, integrity, performance, respect, agility, and collaboration to the workplace? Then, you would fit right in at the inception of MINISO USA. Come join us, let us create a new beginning.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 

* Deliver sales goals by training, motivating, mentoring, and providing feedback to sales staff.
* Oversee entire retail store and overall performance to develop the store employees.
* Ensure elevated levels of customer satisfaction through excellent customer service.
* Support store administration and ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
* Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards by communicating feedback to the Operational Display Team.
* Initiate and implement replenishment strategies within the store.
* Report on buying trends, customer needs, profits, etc.
* Help streamline and control labor costs.
* Interview candidates for sales associate and shift leader positions.
* Conduct personnel performance appraisals to establish training needs, build career paths, and deliver constructive feedback and accountability.
* Product Management: Inventory levels, handling shipment, damages, returns, etc.
* Manage all issues that arise from staff or customers (complaints, grievances, etc.).
* Be a shining example of good behavior and high performance.
* Travel to work at other MINISO locations.
* Other duties as needed.

**Qualifications:** 

* Educational/ Experience: Proven successful experience as a retail manager or shift leader role.
* Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management. Ability to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
* Mathematical Skills: Possess strong mathematical skills to be able to count money accurately and precisely.
* Reasoning Ability: Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to customers and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision.
* Other Sills: Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service. Powerful leadership skills, organizational skills, and business orientation.
* Work Hours: Available to work a variety of hours, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to travel and/or relocate to various locations and manage additional stores based on company’s needs.

**Physical Requirements:** 

* Ability to stand, bend, stoop, reach, push, pull, and lift up to 40 lbs. in items occasionally (up to 10 times per hour).
* Ability to work extended periods of time (up to 6 hours) standing or walking.
* Ability to perform repetitive motions for short periods of time (up to 3 hours continuously).
* Ability to place and arrange items on shelves and racks daily.
* Ability to read instructions, reports, and information on computer/register screens and to key information into the computer daily.
* Ability to work in retail stores; move about retail stores floors and rooms; review, revise, create retail paperwork.

MINISO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented individuals from a diverse candidate pool.

**#LoveMiniso**

Pay: $23.00 per hour

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10036: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Coaching Manager
description:
**COMPANY PROFILE:**  

Soccer Shots is the leader in youth soccer development for children ages 2-8. Our nationally recognized program offers a high energy, fun, age-appropriate introduction to the wonderful game of soccer. Our innovative curriculum emphasizes both soccer skills and character development. Our goal is simple: to leave a lasting, positive impact on every child we serve.  

  

**SOCCER SHOTS COUS:**  

Soccer Shots COUS (Company Owned Units or COUS) was established in 2010. COUS covers the regions of DC, Maryland, Northern Virginia, Miami, New York City Central, NY, and Nashville, TN. Soccer Shots Baltimore-Washington stretches from Harford County, MD to Prince William County, VA. Soccer Shots NYC Central covers Manhattan and Brooklyn. COUS works closely with Soccer Shots Franchising national headquarters in Middletown, PA.  

  

**BENEFITS/PERKS:**  

* Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
* Health savings account
* Retirement plan with 3% company match / Simple IRA
* Eligible for seasonal customer satisfaction bonus and end of year bonus
* 15 PTO days + one extra day per year of service
* 10 paid holidays
* Remote work on Fridays


  

**COMPENSATION:** $65,000  

  

**REPORTS TO:** Executive Director  

  

**OBJECTIVES:** Oversee Soccer Shots' coaching department in New York City Central and continually improve the standard of coaching across the region. This role will be asked to perform the following functions:  

  

*Coaching, Training, and Staff Leadership*  

* Implement the company’s high standard for coaching, and develop a team of high performing coaches
* Assist in the recruitment of coaches, interview process for prospective coaches, on-boarding for new coaches, performance assessment, and development of coaches.
* Create the schedule and execute seasonal evaluations on all coaches
* Ensure all coaches complete our training process
* Responsible for creating a culture representative of Soccer Shots Core Values within the team
* Responsible for schedule completion for each season (online registration & calendars)
* Appropriately prepare staff needs for upcoming season, and forecast needs for future seasons
* Coach sessions based on business need
* Manage/supervise part-time coaches
* Responsible for planning, preparing, and executing the seasonal coaches meetings
* Create and develop processes that enhance the Coaching Department


  

*Administration*  

* Responsible for approving coach’s payroll and time off requests
* Collaborate with People Operations Department to ensure compliance with coaches
* Manage equipment, gear, and supplies
* Execute start weeks and in-season responsibilities


  

*Marketing*  

* Responsible for running program demos, distributing registration forms and brochures, hanging lobby and classroom posters, and in-school displays, distributing final reminders, placing bandit signs, and promoting public programs
* Communicate with parents, directors, and other partners as needed
* Represent Soccer Shots at industry events, open houses, etc.


  

*Sales/Growth*  

* Provide leads in the territory served
* Optimize coaching resources to increase yield at partner sites


  

**WORKING HOURS/LOCATION/SCHEDULE:**  

The job description above is a full-time, exempt position requiring a minimum 40 hours of work per week. Your weekly agenda and schedule will be assigned by your supervisor. Working weekdays, weeknights, and weekends is normal. Weekend programs run from 9am-12pm and weeknight programs run from 5pm-7pm.  

  

**SOCCER SHOTS OBJECTIVES:**  

1. For Soccer Shots to be the best run, most popular, and most successful program offered in New York City Central  

2. For Soccer Shots to have a reputation of excellence. An objective measure of each territory’s reputation for quality will be learned in the Net Promoter Score survey conducted at the end of each season  

3. To be a Top 10% franchise in participant registration and revenue (in category) and per capita rating and to meet and exceed seasonal and annual enrollment and revenue goals  

  

**COMPANY EXPECTATIONS:**  

1. Prompt, reliable, and professional communication—responds immediately to customers (parents, directors, staff), and always responds to supervisor and other Soccer Shots support staff within 24 hours  

2. Meet weekly, seasonal, and annual timelines and deadlines. Develop systems to stay organized, keep good records, and be efficient with your time  

3. Meet seasonal performance goals. Go above and beyond company expectations to sell, promote and market our program prior to each season  

4. Provide excellent customer service by communicating through newsletters to parents, and phone calls/visits with center directors  

5. Adhere to all company policies and represent Soccer Shots with professionalism and integrity  

6. Hire, train, and manage a staff of coaches who will uphold a standard of excellence and create a positive reputation for Soccer Shots  

  

**COMMITMENTS:**  

Soccer Shots employees are committed to representing Soccer Shots in a fashion consistent with the company's three Core Values. Compensation is based on performance, and Soccer Shots reserves the right to terminate employment for failure to meet expectations.  

  

**PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS AND REVIEWS:**  

* Performance will be reviewed after the first 60 days of employment
* Objectives of the position and company expectations will be reviewed quarterly through a meeting with supervisor
* Soccer Shots will perform an annual review in June and December of each calendar year
company_addresses: 1020 S. Eisenhower Boulevard, Middletown, PA, United States, Pennsylvania
company_description: Soccer Shots is the premier intro-to-soccer program designed for children ages 2 to 8. With franchises across 43 US states and 2 Canadian provinces, our program serves over 500,000 children each year!

title: Tech Lead - Application Development & Support
description:
**Summary**  

This position will report to the Vice President, CIO Domain Leader and provide technical expertise, proactive leadership, and guidance on all matters associated with the applications/platforms within the area of influence and is the primary person to advise on the advancement of the digital strategy. This position is also the chief liaison to DB&T leadership to coordinate work with the rest of the client and business/functional units.  

  

**Primary Duties/Responsibilities**
  

* Guide and support digital initiatives to enhance domain performance, efficiency, profitability, and safety
* Lead and manage application support and development teams, including hiring, training, and performance evaluations. Review, approve, and allocate work assignments to staff.
* Develop and implement strategies to improve the performance and efficiency of their team.
* Lead process improvement initiatives, such as participating in user group meetings to identify areas for improvement
* Oversee the day-to-day operations of their team, ensuring that issues are resolved in a timely manner.
* Challenge, assist, and advise on the technical & application solutions to be implemented
* Pilot and manage technical crises, report alerts, and arbitration needs to the authorities adapted
* Perform a permanent technological watch allowing him to be the technical referent on his perimeter. Work closely with the CTO for guidance on new technologies and solutions.
* Provide level 3 support for its scope
* Ensure the coordination and compliance with the security standards and architecture of the IS on its perimeter
* Ensure the compliance of developments with security standards
* Manage the various audits (technical, security, and publishers) that may occur within its scope
* Ensure the application mapping respects the standards set forth by the Chief Technology Office
* Define the technical base of its perimeter to meet the requirements of the digital transformation plans
* Control the environment and promotes continuous integration within its scope
* Manage the technical debt of its scope
* Design and validate the technical architecture of its scope
* Set up procedures and tools allowing continuous integration (Jenkins, JIRA, Gitlab...)
* Contribute to the improvement of practices and methods implemented
* Organize and supervise the production launches of its scope
* Verify and ensure the quality and performance of the operation of the developments within its scope
* Blueprint functional and technical change documentation and work as the liaison between the business and outsourced service providers to deliver the services and changes to the applications as necessary
* Provide senior leadership with regular project status & reporting
* Create and present business cases, plus identify business needs in a timely and efficient manner
* Collaborate with Project Managers and Solution Delivery teams to identify appropriate internal and external resources necessary to accomplish project deliverables on time and on budget
* Manage stakeholder expectations through clear, concise, and professional presentations and communications
* Lead efficient team operations that promote modernization and upgrades of DB&T and BU/Domain systems
* Conduct performance evaluations and career planning with DB&T staff that are timely and constructive
* Mentor staff members to ensure their goals align with BU/Domain goals and the staff members' personal development goals
* Understand AGILE project management methodologies


  

**Education/experience/background**
  

* Undergraduate degree in Information Systems or related field, Graduate degree a plus
* Minimum of 10 years of information technology
* Extensive experience in partnering with operations as well as leading and managing the department
* Experience working with outside firms to augment staff when required
* Prior industry knowledge beneficial


  

**Knowledge/Skills**
  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills (including presentation skills), including the ability to influence and negotiate through expertise
* Outstanding relationship-building skills
* Proficient project management, time management and continuous improvement skills
* Superior problem solving and financial analysis skills
* In-depth knowledge of software development practices
* Familiarity with database architecture and design
* General knowledge of various enterprise platforms
* Ability/Willingness to work with Global peers to share best practices to further the VNA business

title: Early Elementary School Math and ELA Tutor
description:
**Position: Elementary School Math & ELA Tutor - Bronx NY**  

  

**Job Description:** We are seeking math and ELA tutors to join our team and work as push in support for teachers at PS 103, located at 4125 Carpenter Ave, Bronx, NY 10466. The students will need to receive support in early elementary school (grades K-1) math and ELA, in small group sessions with a 5:1 ratio as well as 1:1 work as needed. Starting on Thursday, September 5th until Friday, December 20th, tutors will work in-person at the school site Mondays through Fridays from 8:30 am to 2pm.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as an ELA or math tutor in elementary school settings is preferred
* Willingness to work as a team and support both teachers and students
* Strong communication skills required to collaborate with teachers and students
* Available to work the hours specified above between Monday-Friday at the school site
* Dedication to supporting academic and personal success, particularly among minority and low-income students.
* Passion for educational equity and social justice

**Responsibilities:**  

As an Education Champion, you will work collaboratively with teachers and school leaders to provide the targeted support and interventions students need on any given day. You'll be assigned to small group instruction. Your role will be instrumental in ensuring students have the rigorous and culturally responsive educational support they deserve.  

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Competitive pay rate of $22/hr with the opportunity to earn $24.20/hr\\* with a completion bonus.
* Education Champions are not paid during school breaks (Winter Break, Spring Break, etc.).
* Education Champions will be required to attend one 30-minute event per quarter and complete 5 minutes of asynchronous training per week.

**Acknowledgment:**  

PRACTICE partners with some of New York City's most struggling public schools to improve academic outcomes for low-income students and their families. Flexibility is required, as there may be occasions when a school recognizes a more pressing need for your time and talents than originally anticipated. You may be asked to teach a different grade or subject. Our team expects you to be flexible and committed to furthering our mission of advancing equitable education for urban students by closing the opportunity gap.

* Bonus based on starting and completing the program and maintaining your EC Quality Review.

title: Server/Waiter
description:
**Indian Trail Club** is seeking enthusiastic, upbeat personalities to join our team at the McBride House Restaurant! We are open 6 days a week and are hiring for front of house positions that range from opening to closing schedules.

***\\*\\*Job Knowledge and Expectations\\*\\****

- Greet and acknowledge members and guests.

- Be knowledgeable about the menu and wine list.

- Ability to time the service of each course efficiently.

- Learn and remember members’ names and their special preferences.

- Possess a solid understanding of wines and spirits.

- Be prepared to perform required roles during emergency situations.

- Learn and proficiently use the POS system.

- Must have prior experience in a country club setting.

***\\*\\*Job Summary (Essential Functions) \\*\\****

Provide exceptional food and beverage service to club members and guests.

- Set up side stations and perform assigned side work.

- Provide immediate attention to all members and guests upon seating.

- Ensure children are seated safely and securely.

- Distribute food and wine menus and answer any questions.

- Fill glasses with ice water and suggest menu items.

- Ensure correct account numbers and names are provided for billing.

- Serve food and drinks efficiently and courteously, offering suggestions on daily specials and wine selections.

- Keep dining room and bus station areas clean.

- Report any complaints to the supervisor as soon as they occur.

- Perform clean-up and closing duties as assigned by the manager.

- Attend pre-meal meetings as requested by the Dining Room Manager.

- Thank members and guests and invite them to return.

- Consistently follow local and state laws and the club’s policies for serving alcoholic beverages.

- Perform other duties as assigned by the Dining Room Manager or Dining Room Captain.

- Must be of legal age to serve alcoholic beverages.

- Required to stand for long periods and walk, climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend, stretch, and twist or reach.

**Veterinary Technicians** and **Veterinary Assistants** are on the front lines of nursing care, providing appropriate medical care and treatments as ordered by the veterinarian. On any given day, you will:* Triage patients as needed
* Run laboratory tests
* Calculate medical math
* Place IV catheters and institute fluid therapy
* Maintain accurate treatment sheets and anesthesia records
* Obtain and prepare various blood samples for diagnostic testing
* Assess pain scale of patients and support as needed
* Act as patient’s advocate and provide quality, compassionate care for hospitalized patients
* Provide client education on a wide range of at home care
* Administer and monitor anesthesia
* Administer medications
* Assist in patient care
* Help keep hospital clean and stocked
* Assist with phone calls and checking in clients

  

**About you:*** Veterinary Technician, CVT/LVT preferred or a minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Veterinary Technician and proficient with anesthetic monitoring
* Veterinary Assistant; preferred 1 year experience
* Proficiency in processing basic laboratory specimens
* Working knowledge of anatomy and physiology
* Understanding of normal vs abnormal physiologic ranges
* Commitment to help mentor and train veterinary assistants
* Ability to work well and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Compassionate, positive outlook and friendly, team-orientated attitude
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* The ability to deliver exceptional client service
* Honesty, integrity, and a desire to learn and have fun!

  

**Schedule (Veterinary Technician):*** Tuesday and Wednesday, 7pm -8am
* Sunday - Wednesday, 7PM - 8AM
* Thursday - Saturday, 8:30PM - 8AM

  

**GSVS is proud to offer the following benefits:*** Mental health support with Talkspace
* Uniforms provided

title: Veterinary Client Service Representative
description:
**Garden State Veterinary Specialist Eatontown** is excited to announce we are hiring Client Service Representative to support our busy hospital.  

  

  

  

  

**The Client Service Representative** is one of the most important positions in our emergency/specialty practice as you are on the front lines, there to greet each client who walks in the door, setting the stage for a positive client experience. Our CSRs are ambassadors of GSVS and will be responsible for checking clients in and out of the hospital, booking appointments, taking payments, and fielding busy phone lines. This position requires experience in a fast-paced customer facing role, and while veterinary experience is preferred, we would happily train and invest in the right candidate.  

  

**About GSVS:** We are a multispecialty practice with boarded veterinary specialists in Emergency and Critical Care, Surgery, Internal Medicine, Neurology, Oncology, Dermatology, Cardiology, Rehabilitation, and Ophthalmology. We have also been treating felines with hyperthyroid disease with radioactive iodine since 2001! We are also proud to have technicians here at GSVS with their VTS in Internal Medicine and Cardiology.  

  

**Why GSVS:** We are not your typical veterinary hospital! We know the winning recipe to maintain the care and compassion that our patients depend upon us for, is to create a safe and supportive space for you to put your skills to use, develop new skills, and be a part of our highly collaborative, fun, and friendly team! We are proud of our company culture and positive staff engagement within a fast paced, learning environment; and our associate employment longevity is proof of our commitment to take care of one another, and provide the highest standard of care to the patients we serve.  

  

**About you:*** 1+ years experience in a client service role
* Excellent communication skills are expected as you will often act as a liaison between the clients and the clinical staff
* Ability to answer multiple phone lines
* Data entry and attention to detail
* Comfort with taking deposits and discussing financial questions with clients
* Empathy and compassion for our clients
* Ability to be discreet and professional when appropriate
* Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment and commitment to develop long-term relationships with colleagues, clients, and community
* Positive outlook and ability to work well in a collaborative environment
* Honesty, integrity, and a desire to learn and have fun!

  

**Shifts:** Monday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, 12pm - 10:30PM (Some holidays are required)  

  

**Salary:** Starting rate of $21/hr
  

  

**GSVS is proud to offer the following benefits:*** Health, dental, and vision insurance, some plans paid 100%
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Retirement Plan – 401K with employer match
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Paid Time off
* Mental health support with Talkspace
* Uniforms provided
* Pet discounts for medical care

  

Garden State Veterinary Specialists is located at 246 Industrial Way, Eatontown, NJ 07724  

  

#SUPPORT*Veritas Veterinary Partners is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the requirements of all applicable federal, state and local laws, we welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status.*

title: Diversion Project Coordinator
description:
**Job Description:**  

  

Shift: First Shift  

The Diversion Project Coordinator will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing a diversion program that will be implemented at a local law enforcement agency. The diversion program will focus on reducing criminalization for low-level crimes of poverty for 12-24 year olds, and includes implementation of a screening tool for human trafficking by law enforcement. The Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring successful implementation of the project. This will include serving as the primary liaison for law enforcement, and providing training and technical assistance.


**Duties and responsibilities**

* Lead development of training and technical assistance materials
* Support development of adapted screening tool and screening protocol
* Collaborate with NJOAG and other project partners to develop diversion program protocol
* Schedule, coordinate, and conduct trainings on screening for human trafficking with law enforcement agencies
* Support implementation of use of screening tool and diversion program within designated law enforcement agencies
* Recruit pilot law enforcement agencies as needed
* Ensure implemented protocols maintain fidelity to project model and best practices
* Facilitate meetings with stakeholders and project partners
* Establish contacts and build relationships with relevant stakeholders and project partners. Ensure partners remain focused on the goals of the project, and move in a timely fashion toward the project goals.
* Lead the quality improvement process for the project by being responsive to feedback and outcomes data. Evaluate protocols and outcomes for effectiveness, scalability, and replicability
* Support fulfillment of grant reporting requirements
* Lead development of clear, accurate, and informative reports that highlight outcomes and tools to support replicability
* Perform other related duties, responsibilities and special projects as assigned
* Liaise with OAG and law enforcement agencies to obtain data on a regular basis
* Ability to organize and develop effective work methods
* Knowledge of purposes policies, standards and procedures involved in doing social work as it relates to homelessness, human trafficking, and other identified barriers


Applicant Must be available to work: Monday thru Friday 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Must have the flexibility to adjust work schedule when needed to meet with law enforcement after normal work hours for trainings etc.


* This Position is a 18 month grant funded position which may or may not be renewed.

  

**Experience and Skills:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in social work, criminal justice, public policy, or a related field required. Master’s Degree preferred.
* Minimum 5 years experience in a related field.
* Experience working in, with, or training law enforcement preferred.
* Knowledge of human trafficking, and experience working with survivors of human trafficking preferred
* Established record of effectiveness at project management preferred.
* Strong skills in Canva and developing slide decks preferred
* Valid NJ Driver’s license with an insurable driving record.
* Individuals with lived experience of human trafficking and/or homelessness are strongly encouraged to apply

 **Job Benefits:**


Health Insurance


Dental Insurance


Vision Plan


403B


Paid Holidays


Benefit Days (Vacation, Personal, Sick)


Tuition Reimbursement  

  

From: Covenant House of NJ

title: Resource Specialist/ Data Manager
description:
**Job Description:**  

  

Shift: First Shift  

The Resource Specialist/Data Manager is responsible for providing case management to victims of human trafficking who are identified through a diversion program for 12-24 year old potential victims of human trafficking identified through law enforcement at the point of arrest. Additionally, the Resource Specialist/Data Manager will be responsible for compiling, monitoring, and evaluating all data collected through the project, as well as supporting any relevant reporting.


**Duties and responsibilities**

* Compile and organize data
* Monitor and maintain data quality
* Conduct analysis of data to evaluate project outcomes
* Support integration of project data collection needs into existing databases
* Support writing of white papers and research reports
* Ensure statistical and data management reports are generated and distributed in a timely fashion
* Interpret complex data; perform analysis of data and present to a variety of audiences
* Evaluate protocols and outcomes for effectiveness, scalability, and replicability
* Lead development of a report that details outcomes, finding, and a toolkit
* Support fulfillment of grant reporting requirements
* Provide direct services to potential victims identified through the diversion program
* Conduct assessment to determine if potential victims have had experiences that meet the legal definition of human trafficking
* Field calls from anti-trafficking hotlines and facilitate intake or referrals for callers seeking services.
* Work directly with individual victims of human trafficking to coordinate core services.
* Refer and connect all victims between 18-24 years old to appropriate CHNJ residential programming for emergency shelter and provision of core services.
* Provide case management to all victims of human trafficking to connect victims with core services in the appropriate geographic locations.
* Track and manage linkages to outside referrals.
* Collect and enter data into the ETO database.
* Provide on-call services to victims of human trafficking (rotating schedule).
* Perform other related duties, responsibilities and special projects as assigned
* Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate and informative reports
* Ability to organize and develop effective work methods
* Knowledge of purposes policies, standards and procedures involved in doing social work as it relates to homelessness, human trafficking, and other identified barriers.
* Applicant must be available to work Monday thru Friday (Day Shift).
* Applicant Must be available to work On-call Monday- Sunday and on holidays, on a rotating basis

  

**Experience and Skills:*** Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in social work, criminal justice, or a related field required.
* Minimum of 2 years experience in a related field.
* Knowledge of human trafficking, and experience working with survivors of human trafficking preferred
* Established record of effectiveness at project management preferred.
* Valid NJ Driver’s license with an insurable driving record.
* Individuals with lived experience of human trafficking and/or homelessness are strongly encouraged to apply

  

**Job Benefits:**
Health Insurance


Dental Insurance


Vision Plan


403B


Paid Holidays


Benefit Days (Vacation, Personal, Sick)


Tuition Reimbursement

title: Primary Youth Advisor overnight
description:
**Job Description:**  

  

Shift: Third Shift  

The Primary Youth Advisor (PYA) is responsible for providing the delivery of care and services to all youth with absolute respect and unconditional love. The PYA must create opportunities for building community amongst young people that is inclusive and affirming, ensuring young people feel welcomed, seen, heard and valued. The PYA is responsible for inspiring and motivating youth; by creating an environment which engages youth and gives them voice and choice. To provide direct, individualized, supportive care to youth who utilize the Youth Engagement Center.


**Duties and responsibilities**

* Coach youth in the development of their success plans. Work with youth to explore current and future opportunities.
* Build a supportive relationship with youth that encourages them to find their voice and connects them to opportunities, experiences and resources that enrich and enhance their lives.
* Ensure that the needs of the youth are met at all times, prioritizing safety while providing guardrails and maintaining a spirit of flexibility.
* Create learning opportunities which offer youth voice, choice and are adaptive.
* Contribute to a dynamic atmosphere where youth can experience a supportive relationship.
* Find opportunities to engage with youth all in program spaces.
* Participate in success plan meetings as scheduled.
* Participate in daily community meetings.
* Document information regarding all client interaction, caseload progress and outside agency contact.
* Complete all related documentation including census, intake, assessments and transition.
* Ensure allocation and documentation of petty cash and bus tickets.
* Utilizing agency resources which include but are not limited to the vehicles, computers, telephones for agency use only.
* Required to check and respond to company e-mail and voice mails daily.
* Assists as needed with fundraising affairs and special events which may be conducted outside the employee’s normal work schedule.
* Attend professional development training as assigned.

* All other duties as assigned by the Coordinator of Service Management or Associate Director of Service Management.


Applicant Must be available to work the following schedule: Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday & Sunday 10:00PM- 8:00 AM; Days Off: Monday, Tuesday & Friday  



  

**Experience and Skills:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a human service preferred.
* Excellent communication and crisis management skills and the ability to handle physically challenging situations.
* Excellent assessment and judgment capabilities.
* Valid drivers license with an insurable record
* Willing to travel between Covenant House sites

 **Job Benefits:**


Health Insurance


Dental Insurance


Vision Plan


403B


Paid Holidays Benefit Days (Vacation, Personal, Sick)


Tuition Reimbursement

title: ADP Consultant
description:
**MUST BE LOCAL TO THE NYC AREA! Will come into the NYC office for team meetings! Contract position but will work approximately 40 hours per week on EST schedule.**  

  

**About Us**


Thrive is a rapidly growing technology solutions provider focusing upon Cloud, Cyber Security, Networking, Disaster Recovery and Managed Services. Our corporate culture, engineering talent, customer-centric approach, and focus upon “next generation” services help us stand out amongst our peers. Thrive is on the look-out for individuals who don’t view their weekdays spent at “a job”, but rather look to develop valuable skills that ignite their passion and lead to a CAREER. If you’re attracted to a “work hard, play hard” environment, seeking the guidance, training and experience necessary to build a lucrative career, then welcome to THRIVE!!

**Position Overview**


The ADP Consultant will assist in establishing ADP as Thrive’s Global System of Record. ADP is currently Thrive’s North American payroll system; this person will implement ADP globally for payroll, performance, PTO tracking and connect ADP to our ATS (Jazz HR). This position involves working closely with our internal team and ADP to understand our specific needs, configure ADP systems to meet those requirements, and provide training and support throughout the implementation process.

**Responsibilities**

* Work with our internal stakeholders to gather and document detailed requirements for the ADP system
* Ensure all systems (payroll, ATS, performance management, etc.) are integrated with ADP and ADP services as the Global System of Record
* Conduct thorough assessment of client needs and business processes
* Help manage the project timeline and deliverables to ensure timely and successful implementation
* Validate data accuracy and integrity throughout the implementation process
* Communicate project status and potential issues to the CFO and relevant stakeholders
* Assist in the accurate import and migration of data to ADP
* Ensure all system setups are accurate and adhere to our business requirements and best practices
* Provide training sessions to our staff on the effective use of ADP systems
* Offer ongoing support during and after implementation to address any issues and ensure smooth operation

**Qualifications**

* Minimum eight years of ADP Implementation and upgrade experience
* Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college/university; advanced degree in finance, accounting, business information systems
* Strong verbal and analytical skills with the ability to write at a client facing business communications level
* Detailed understanding of ERP System concepts and general module functionality
* Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future
